_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The three persons who meditate observing: The first person who realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
The second person whose defilements and life come to an end at exactly the same time
The third person who is extinguished between one life and the next with the ending of the five lower fetters
The four persons who are extinguished wi: They're extinguished between one life and the next
The seventh person [an7.19:3.8]: With the ending of the five lower fetters, they head upstream
They go to the Akaniṭṭha realm
